critique.user_prompt:
# ORIGINAL TEXT
This page is meant to be simple view into what is happening in my life
right **now**. Inspired by [@NowNowNow.](https://nownownow.com/) and Derek Sivers.

# CURRENT TRANSLATION
Esta página está pensada como una visión sencilla de lo que está pasando justo **ahora** en mi vida.  
Inspirada por [@NowNowNow](https://nownownow.com/) y Derek Sivers.

Please critique this translation mercilessly and provide detailed feedback on what needs to be improved.
Format your critique as a structured list of issues, organized by severity and category.
Include specific suggestions for how to fix each issue.
critique.response:
CRITIQUE OF THE SPANISH TRANSLATION  
(Severity scale: 1 = Critical / distorts meaning; 2 = Major / noticeably awkward; 3 = Minor / polish)

────────────────────────────────────────
1. ACCURACY & MEANING
────────────────────────────────────────
1-A  (2) “está pensada como una visión”  
• Issue The English “meant to be a simple view into” conveys purpose (“to serve as”) and direction (“into”). “Estar pensado como” partially covers purpose but “visión” does not render the idea of “peeking/looking into” somebody’s life.  
• Fix Use “pretende ser/constituye” + “mirada/vista” or “mirada sencilla a”.  
 Ej.: «Esta página pretende ser una mirada sencilla a lo que ocurre…»

1-B  (3) Order of adverbial phrase “justo ahora en mi vida”  
• Issue Placing “justo ahora” before “en mi vida” weakens the focus on the temporal aspect.  
• Fix «…en mi vida justo ahora» / «…en mi vida en este momento».

1-C  (3) Loss of nuance of “right **now**” (emphatic)  
• Issue “justo ahora” is fine, but “ahora mismo” or “en este preciso momento” are more idiomatic in many dialects. Bold-face was kept, though.

────────────────────────────────────────
2. STYLE, REGISTER & NATURALNESS
────────────────────────────────────────
2-A  (2) Sentence fragment “Inspirada por…”  
• Issue Standing alone, “Inspirada” functions as a dangling participle. Grammatically it refers back to “página”, but Spanish normally demands an explicit verb for clarity.  
• Fix «Está inspirada en/por…» OR fold into previous sentence: «…en mi vida justo ahora, y está inspirada en…»

2-B  (2) Preposition “por” after “inspirada”  
• Issue Both “por” and “en” are acceptable, but “inspirarse en” is more idiomatic for intellectual/artistic influence.  
• Fix «inspirada en [@NowNowNow] y en Derek Sivers».

2-C  (2) Lexical choice “visión sencilla”  
• Issue “visión” can sound lofty or metaphysical; here we want something down-to-earth.  
• Fix «mirada sencilla» / «vista simple» / «panorama sencillo».

────────────────────────────────────────
3. GRAMMAR & PUNCTUATION
────────────────────────────────────────
3-A  (1) Missing accent on “esta” is correct (demonstrative without tilde), no error.

3-B  (2) Link punctuation  
• Issue The original English includes the period inside the markdown link text. Spanish doesn’t require the period inside the link, but if you keep it, be consistent with the original or move the period outside.  
• Fix Either «[@NowNowNow.](…)» (keep the dot) or «[@NowNowNow](…)».

────────────────────────────────────────
4. CONSISTENCY & TERMINOLOGY
────────────────────────────────────────
4-A  (2) “justo ahora” vs. “ahora” in bold  
• Issue Two adverbs used (“justo ahora” and bold “ahora”) may read repetitive; unify.

────────────────────────────────────────
5. MACHINE-LIKE / LITERAL FEEL
────────────────────────────────────────
5-A  (2) Overall word-for-word feel (“está pensada como una visión”) suggests calque of English structure. A more Spanish-native restructuring would read smoother.

────────────────────────────────────────
SUGGESTED REVISED TRANSLATION (illustrative)

Esta página pretende ser una mirada sencilla a lo que ocurre en mi vida **ahora mismo**.  
Está inspirada en [@NowNowNow](https://nownownow.com/) y en Derek Sivers.

This version:
• uses “pretende ser” for purpose  
• chooses “mirada sencilla” for naturalness  
• places the temporal phrase after “vida”  
• repairs the sentence fragment with “Está”  
• employs “inspirada en” for idiomatic usage.

=========================
CRITIQUE OF THE SPANISH VERSION
=========================

A. CRITICAL ISSUES  (must-fix to preserve meaning)

1. Slight shift in the metaphor “simple view into …”
   • Problem:  “una sencilla ventana a” changes the image.  The English uses the word “view,” not “window,” so the stress is on the act of looking rather than on the object you look through.  
   • Fix:  Use “una visión sencilla de” or “una vista simple de” to stay concept-faithful.  
   → Suggested rewrite: «…ser una visión sencilla de lo que…»

B. MAJOR ISSUES  (impact fluency or naturalness)

2. Verb choice “pretende ser”
   • Problem:  In Spanish this can sound as if the page is “pretending” or “claiming” rather than “intended.”  
   • Fix:  Prefer «está pensada para ser» or «tiene como fin ser».  
   → «Esta página está pensada para ser…»

3. Preposition after “Inspirada”
   • Problem:  «Inspirada en» is acceptable, but in this context «Inspirada por» (by) mirrors the source more accurately and sounds more idiomatic.  
   • Fix:  «Inspirada por @NowNowNow y Derek Sivers.»

C. MINOR / STYLISTIC ISSUES  (polish)

4. Emphasis formatting
   • Problem:  Only **ahora** is bolded, leaving «mismo» outside the emphasis; the nuance is fine, but the visual balance feels clipped.  
   • Fix (optional):  Either bold the full phrase **ahora mismo** or just **ahora** depending on desired focus.  

5. Slight register mismatch in “lo que sucede”
   • Observation:  «lo que sucede» is correct, but «lo que está pasando» or «lo que ocurre» can sound a touch more colloquial, matching the informal tone of the original blog-like text.

6. Punctuation after the link
   • The source puts the period inside the link text (“NowNowNow.”), which looks odd in Spanish. You already corrected this—good. If you keep the period outside the hyperlink (recommended), no further action needed.

D. CONSISTENCY / TERMINOLOGY

No technical terms appear; consistency is fine.

E. MACHINE-LIKE / LITERAL RED FLAGS

None major. The translation reads human, but the “ventana” choice hints at literal rendering from “window.” Adjusting to “visión/vista” will remove that impression.

=========================
SUGGESTED REVISED VERSION
=========================

Esta página está pensada para ser una visión sencilla de lo que está pasando en mi vida **ahora mismo**.  
Inspirada por [@NowNowNow](https://nownownow.com/) y Derek Sivers.

This incorporates all fixes while keeping the casual, concise tone of the original.

CRITIQUE OF THE SPANISH TRANSLATION  
(Organized by severity → Critical · Major · Minor)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
A. ACCURACY & FIDELITY
───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1. Critical – “simple view” ⇢ “visión sencilla”  
   • Problem: “Visión” in Spanish usually evokes eyesight, prophecy or a broad conceptual outlook, not a quick, informal “peek.”  
   • Impact: Loses the idea of a small window/peek into the author’s life.  
   • Fix: “una mirada sencilla”, “un vistazo simple”, or “una vista sencilla”.

2. Critical – Nuance of “into” completely absent  
   • The English “view into what is happening” suggests an opening/window. Spanish “de lo que está pasando” merely states a topic.  
   • Fix: “una mirada sencilla a lo que sucede en mi vida” (preposition “a” conveys entry/insight).

3. Major – Verb phrase “is meant to be” ⇢ “está pensada para ser”  
   • Too literal; sounds engineered, not intention-driven.  
   • Fix: “pretende ser”, “quiere ser” or “nace como”.

4. Minor – Loss of emphasis in “right now”  
   • “ahora mismo” is fine, but moving it to sentence end softens urgency.  
   • Fix: Keep near the verb: “...lo que está sucediendo ahora mismo en mi vida”.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
B. STYLE, TONE & NATURALNESS
───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
5. Major – Mechanical sentence skeleton  
   • Repetition of copula “estar + participio + para ser” is clunky.  
   • Suggested rewrite (combines fixes 1-4):  
     “Esta página pretende ser una mirada sencilla a lo que sucede ahora mismo en mi vida.”

6. Major – “Inspirada por”  
   • Idiomatic Spanish favours “Inspirada en”.  
   • Fix: “Inspirada en [@NowNowNow](…) y en Derek Sivers.”

7. Minor – Register mismatch: “sencilla” vs. “simple”  
   • Source uses “simple”; “sencilla” is fine yet softer. Keep parallelism?  
   • Optional: “…una mirada simple a…”

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
C. GRAMMAR & ORTHOGRAPHY
───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
8. Minor – Punctuation / sentence boundary  
   • In Spanish, full stop before line break is advisable.  
   • Current: “vida  \n**ahora mismo**.”  
   • Acceptable option: keep one clear period, then line-break.

9. Minor – Comma usage  
   • Could insert a comma before “ahora mismo” if kept at end for rhythm:  
     “…en mi vida, ahora mismo.”

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
D. CONSISTENCY & TECHNICAL PRESENTATION
───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
10. Minor – Link formatting fidelity  
    • Original English keeps the period inside the link text “[@NowNowNow.]”; Spanish dropped the dot. Decide whether to replicate original punctuation or adapt to Spanish typography.  

11. Minor – Capitalization of anchors  
    • Maintain exact casing “@nownownow” vs. “@NowNowNow” per source (the Spanish version copied OK).

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
E. MACHINE-LIKE OR OVERLY LITERAL TRACES
───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
12. Major – “está pensada para ser” + “visión” combo feels calque-driven, i.e., literal rendering of English structure rather than idiomatic Spanish.
